newsitem.title: UK: UK-Americas air cargo buoyant despite sterling gai.
newsitem.headline: UK-Americas air cargo buoyant despite sterling gai.

text.p: Airfreight trading from the UK to North and Latin America is in a healthy state despite the traditional off-peak season for the industry and at a time when sterling continues to strengthen, a Reuters survey shows.

"Our ex-UK transatlantic business was marginally up in January over the same month last year and preliminary figures show it was fairly strong in the first week of February," Steve Buckerfield, American Airlines UK cargo sales manager, said.
He added a discount scheme now being offered by British Airways which includes the North Atlantic and is valid until March 2, was having no noticeable adverse affect on AA's bookings.

Meanwhile, AA Cargo and the rest of the air cargp industry on both sides of the Atlantic were awaiting the next moves of the airline's pilots union, which is threatening an indefinite strike from midnight today, Friday.
